1: The words of King Lemuelâ€”an instruction his mother taught him.\q
2:
What, my son? What is it, son of my womb?\q What do you want, son of my vows?
\q
3:
Do not give your strength to women,\q or your ways to those who destroy kings.


\q
4:
It is not for kings, Lemuel, it is not for kings to drink wine,\q or for rulers to crave strong drink,
\q
5:
because when they drink they forget what has been decreed,\q and pervert the rights of all the afflicted.


\q
6:
Give strong drink to a person who is perishing\q and wine to those in bitter distress.
\q
7:
He will drink and he will forget his poverty\q and he will not remember his trouble.


\q
8:
Speak for those who cannot speak,\q for the causes of all who are perishing.
\q
9:
Speak out and judge by the measure of what is right\q and plead the cause of poor and needy people.

\q
10:
Who can find a capable wife?\q Her value is far more than jewels.
\q
11:
The heart of her husband trusts in her,\q and he will never be poor.
\q
12:
She does good things for him and not evil\q all the days of her life.


\q
13:
She selects wool and flax,\q and works with the delight of her hands.
\q
14:
She is like the merchant ships;\q she brings her food from far away.
\q
15:
She rises while it is night\q and gives food to her household,
\q and she distributes the work for her female servants.


\q
16:
She considers a field and buys it,\q with the fruit of her hands she plants a vineyard.
\q
17:
She dresses herself with strength\q and makes her arms strong.


\q
18:
She perceives what will make a good profit for her;\q all night long her lamp is not extinguished.
\q
19:
She puts her hands on the spindle,\q and she holds the twisting thread.


\q
20:
She reaches out with her hand to poor people;\q she reaches out with her hands to needy people.
\q
21:
She is not afraid of the snow for her household,\q for all her household are clothed in scarlet.


\q
22:
She makes coverings for her bed,\q and she wears clothes of fine purple linen.
\q
23:
Her husband is known at the gates,\q when he sits with the elders of the land.


\q
24:
She makes linen garments and sells them,\q and she supplies sashes to the merchants.
\q
25:
She is clothed with strength and honor,\q and she laughs at the time to come.


\q
26:
She opens her mouth with wisdom\q and the law of kindness is on her tongue.
\q
27:
She watches over the ways of her household\q and does not eat the bread of idleness.


\q
28:
Her children rise up and call her blessed,\q and her husband praises her, saying,
\q
29:
"Many women have done well,\q but you surpassed them all."


\q
30:
Elegance is deceptive, beauty is vain,\q but a woman who fears Yahweh, she will be praised.
\q
31: Give her the fruit of her hands\q and let her works praise her in the gates.
